body:
It has been like this for 6 months (see #2757).

You're going to have to elaborate on what "sets the texture incorrectly" means exactly. How is it incorrect?

Ok I double checked and the bug was added in update 1.5.4 and is in the method loadObject around line 200. It sets all of the textures the same for every object and they are never the right texture (it seems to choose the first texture in the tileset).
Oh and ive seen that issue also. I was happy when it loaded them as rectangle. TextureMapObjects would be better... if they worked :(
You are probably misusing it. The TextureMapObject uses TextureRegion. I am guessing you are then calling getTexture(), which gives you the entire backing texture.
No I am using getTextureRegion. It is just giving me the wrong thing and I'm pretty sure it is loading it incorrectly (my code worked before that update).
Show your code, everything looks correct in the implementation.

I think the line element.getAttribute("gid")  needs to be changed to object.getProperties.get("gid", Integer.class) and use an int instead of a string. I had a nearly identical implementation before that update to load TextureMapObjects from a tiled map except for that string.

Please provide an [SSCCE](http://sscce.org) showing the issue, looking at the implementation, I don't see any problem with how they are loaded. The same region that backs the tile is used to create the object. If the tile works, the object should also work.
? I just showed you my code. Where else should I post it?
Create a complete sample showing the issue... Not two lines of code.
Ok just a minute. I am testing whether I can fix that method.
Alright now I'm not completely sure if it is the loader that is the issue. I will let you know what I come up with after I have done some more testing.
I've tried it myself with (`TmxMapLoader` though) and my texture regions are correct.

Ya I double checked and it is definitely a problem with update 1.5.4. I also tried it with TmxMapLoader and it is working. I think it may be loading the tilesets wrong in AtlasMapLoader, but I need to use the AtlasMapLoader. Anyone know what could be wrong?
The problem is you haven't provided the requested SSCCE.

Haha sorry guys. it was not an issue with my code or libgdx code it was an issue with the way i was packing the texture atlas. I still have no idea why it used to work though, but that doesnt matter anymore. I guess this issue can be deleted now, but im not sure how to do that.
I'm interested, how did you pack it to get this behaviour?
I packed the tilesets and didnt edit the tmx file.... I think... I packed it a long time ago but for some reason it had worked until that update (I just updated yesterday)

I actually have an idea of what probably went wrong here... It is probably related to #2843. It looks like that change might have had some unintended consequences when using multiple tilesets with AtlasTmxMapLoader.
Um ya your right. It is still messing up when I use more tilesets.
Can that commit be undone? It kinda messes up Atlas map loaders.
Please give the next nightly/snapshot a try and see if that fixes it. It is building now.
Yes! Thank you that works perfectly!
